data.title: One Life To Live star Kamar de los Reyes dead at 56
data.meta_description: One Life To Live star Kamar de los Reyes has died at age 56 after a brief battle with cancer.
data.text:
Get the latest from Mark Daniell straight to your inbox

Article content

Kamar de los Reyes, a veteran television, movie and voice actor best known for playing Antonio Vega on the soap opera One Life to Live and a villain in the Call of Duty video game franchise, died Sunday in Los Angeles. He was 56.

One Life To Live star Kamar de los Reyes dead at 56 Back to video

We apologize, but this video has failed to load.

tap here to see other videos from our team.

According to a statement released by his family to PEOPLE, the father of three, who rose to fame after playing villain Antonio Vega on the ABC daytime drama, died Sunday following a brief battle with cancer.

On One Live to Live, de los Reyes earned acclaim alongside his wife and co-star Sherri Saum playing Vega, who was a former gangster-turned-cop and brother of David Fumero’s Cristian Vega. After moving to Los Angeles in the ’80s to pursue his acting dream, De los Reyes landed the career-making part of Vega, portraying him on the soap from 1995 to 1998 before returning from 2000 to 2009.

In a 2007 interview with Urban Latino magazine, de los Reyes praised the show, which ran until 2012, for its groundbreaking representation.

Article content

Advertisement 3

Story continues below

This advertisement has not loaded yet, but your article continues below.

Article content

“We’re one of the few soaps that has an all-Latino family, a Puerto Rican family, which you don’t see much of, not only on daytime but prime time television overall, and is something I feel network television needs to work harder on,” he said. “I think One Life to Live has done a formidable job of that.”

He also had roles on Sleepy Hollow, The Rookie, Law & Order, CSI: Miami, Blue Bloods, The Mentalist, MacGyver, The Passage, Castle, Pretty Little Liars and more. On the big screen, de los Reyes appeared in Oliver Stone’s Nixon, and worked opposite Jennifer Lopez in 2000’s The Cell and Angelina Jolie in 2010’s Salt.

According to his family, at the time of his death, de los Reyes was shooting All American — and had recently completed work on Marvel’s upcoming Daredevil reboot and a new mini-series alongside This Is Us star Sterling K. Brown.

“He was such a beloved member of our All American family,” showrunner Nkechi Okoro Carroll told Deadline of his work as Coach Montes on the CW series. “He brought so much love, light and joy to the set every day, even during his final days. We are so grateful for every moment he spent with us … He truly was a gift. One we will cherish forever.”

In his final Instagram post, de los Reyes was a proud dad, celebrating his eldest boy’s graduation. “Always knew you’d do great things – never dreamed how great,” wrote alongside a photo of his son Caylen posing in military gear. “My pride to have you as my son overwhelms me.”

Article content

De los Reyes is survived by his wife, three sons, Caylen, 26, and twins Michael and John, age 9, his four siblings and his parents.
